intro: Dioscorea tenuiflora, commonly known as Chinese yam, is a herbaceous perennial vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Dioscoreaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its tubers are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in various cultures. The botanical features of D. tenuiflora make it an important species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
